channel.title: Server not connecting
channel.description:
I'm so fucking confused.
My port 43594 is open, my server is set to listen to 0.0.0.0:43594
My client sided Client.java is set to ghostedrebel.no-ip.org, which is being hosted by DUC on my computer, the No-ip.org program to keep the ip up.
It says it's working. Both utorrent, and Vuze/Azereus are set to listen on port 43594, so I don't need to port forward.
My internet connection is working fine..
I'm running [PI] 317
HELP???

item.title: Server not connecting
item.dc:creator: @kleber883 kleber883
item.description:
@kleber883 wrote:

[quote=“Charles Handson, post:7, topic:413690”][quote author=kleber883 link=topic=515651.msg3740645#msg3740645 date=1315317601]

turn off utorrent while running

didnt work, when I did that, I got “error connecting to server” and canyouseeme.org gave me this error “Error: I could not see your service on .*.*. on port (43594)
Reason: Connection timed out”

when i turn it on I get :
“Success: I can see your service on .*.*. on port (43594)
Your ISP is not blocking port 43594”

and “no response from server, please try a different world.” interesting that I’m getting two diff errors on client login…
[/quote]
I believe you need new client. Unless this is a different client than the one that came with the source. People really fuck sources up so bad you need a certain client.[/quote]

do me a favor??? do you have a [PI] client?

or a ip changer??

try to connect to;

Ghostedrebel-no-ip.org

I’m trying different clients now, nothing is working.

ANYONE??

Read full topic

item.title: Server not connecting
item.dc:creator: @Charles_Handson Charles Handson
item.description:
@Charles_Handson wrote:

[quote=“kleber883, post:6, topic:413690”][quote author=iiLovePVP link=topic=515651.msg3740639#msg3740639 date=1315317263]
turn off utorrent while running
[/quote]

didnt work, when I did that, I got “error connecting to server” and canyouseeme.org gave me this error “Error: I could not see your service on .*.*. on port (43594)
Reason: Connection timed out”

when i turn it on I get :
“Success: I can see your service on .*.*. on port (43594)
Your ISP is not blocking port 43594”

and “no response from server, please try a different world.” interesting that I’m getting two diff errors on client login…[/quote]
I believe you need new client. Unless this is a different client than the one that came with the source. People really fuck sources up so bad you need a certain client.

Read full topic

item.description:
@kleber883 wrote:

didnt work, when I did that, I got “error connecting to server” and canyouseeme.org gave me this error “Error: I could not see your service on .*.*. on port (43594)
Reason: Connection timed out”

when i turn it on I get :
“Success: I can see your service on .*.*. on port (43594)
Your ISP is not blocking port 43594”

and “no response from server, please try a different world.” interesting that I’m getting two diff errors on client login…

item.title: Server not connecting
item.dc:creator: @kleber883 kleber883
item.description:
@kleber883 wrote:

Windows firewall is off.
ThreatFire says it’s not blocking.
AVG isn’t blocking…

AND I added exceptions ingoing, and outgoing for port 43594, and for both protocols…

If it means anything, I can see the port is open on canyouseeme.org

Read full topic

item.title: Server not connecting
item.dc:creator: @Charles_Handson Charles Handson
item.description:
@Charles_Handson wrote:

[quote=“kleber883, post:1, topic:413690”]I’m so fucking confused.

My port 43594 is open, my server is set to listen to 0.0.0.0:43594

My client sided Client.java is set to ghostedrebel.no-ip.org, which is being hosted by DUC on my computer, the No-ip.org program to keep the ip up.

It says it’s working. Both utorrent, and Vuze/Azereus are set to listen on port 43594, so I don’t need to port forward.

My internet connection is working fine…

I’m running [PI] 317

HELP???[/quote]
I’m pretty sure ‘uTorrent’ doesn’t work. It’s just so people can trick you into downloading stuff i think not sure tho… you can portforward right from your computer without a wireless router. If you want to know how PM me.

Read full topic
